channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Melania Trump's ex-bestie hits out at her, calls 'unpatriotic' for this reason
item.description: Melania Trump's former friend, Stephanie Winston Wolkoff, who authored the New York Times bestseller Melania and Me: The Rise and Fall of My Friendship with the First Lady alleged that Donald Trump's wife was selling ornaments bearing resemblance to the Presidential Medal of Freedom -- on her site. Stephanie posted photo of the memorabilia on sale on Melania's site and claimed that the former First Lady altered the image of the Medal of Freedom.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Ukraine's primary task is to destroy Russian war potential, create buffer zone in Kursk': Volodymyr Zelenskyy
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy stated that Ukraine's military operations aim to diminish Russia's war potential by conducting maximum counteroffensive actions. Over the weekend, Ukrainian forces targeted and destroyed strategic bridges in Russia's Kursk region, disrupting Russian supply lines. Zelenskyy stressed the achievements in creating a buffer zone to protect Ukrainian communities from Russian shelling.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Delta Airlines attendant hits passenger 'unexpectedly' with loaded beverage cart
item.description: A Florida woman sued Delta Air Lines after a flight attendant allegedly injured her with a beverage cart on a Paris-New York flight. She claims negligence, citing inadequate staff training. Delta faces other legal issues, including a recent emergency landing due to contaminated food and a lawsuit over refunds after a technology outage.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Mass killings in America' karma for 'murder of infants', says North Carolina Lt Guv Mark Robinson
item.description: North Carolina's lieutenant governor, Mark Robinson, during his gubernatorial campaign, has staunchly opposed abortion, likening it to slavery and calling it murder. Despite his harsh stance, he shared a personal story about his wife's abortion, advocating support for mothers. His views have sparked debate and critique from his Democratic opponent.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Like giving Jeffrey Epstein control...': JD Vance was taking a jibe at Kamala Harris
item.description: Donald Trump's running mate JD Vance mentioned sex offender Jeffrey Epstein in a statement Sunday on Fox News. The statement was not about GOP presidential candidate Donald Trump but about his rival vice president Kamala Harris. He used Jeffrey Epstein as an analogy to explain 'Kamala Harris' ineffectiveness' in controlling inflation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Russian climber missing as avalanche hits Russian rescue team in Pakistan
item.description: A Russian mountaineer went missing on Gasherbrum IV in Pakistan at 6,400 metres due to an avalanche. The team was on a mission to retrieve another mountaineer's body from last year. Injured members were airlifted to safety, but rescue missions for the missing climber will commence once weather permits.
item.dc:creator: Omer Farooq Khan

item.title: 'This is Vietnam war of our generation': Anti-Israel protests at Chicago DNC threaten to overshadow Kamala Harris’ nomination
item.description: Tens of thousands of protesters were expected to gather outside the Democratic National Convention in Chicago to oppose the Biden-Harris administration’s support for Israel. Organized by left-wing and Arab- and Muslim-American groups, the protests coincided with key convention events. Despite Biden's endorsement of Harris, organizers anticipated significant turnout, citing ongoing dissatisfaction with US policy toward Israel.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Meme wars between Harris and Trump and the Hunt for Red November
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: GOP Senator Lindsey Graham says Trump may not win 2024 election if...
item.description: Republican senator and Donald Trump loyalist Lindsey Graham said Trump is in danger of losing the election if he fails to focus on policy issues and continues mounting personal attacks of Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris. "President Trump can win this election. If you have a policy debate, he wins. Donald Trump the provocateur, the showman, may not win this election," he said at NBC News' Meet the Press.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Democratic national convention in Chicago: Thousands of activists set to rally for abortion rights and Gaza ceasefire
item.description: Activists gathered in Chicago during the Democratic National Convention to push for policy changes on abortion rights, economic injustice, and a Gaza ceasefire. Illinois Governor J B Pritzker expressed confidence that protests would remain peaceful. Demonstrations are set to continue throughout the convention, highlighting the significance of these pressing issues.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: 'Trump-Harris romantic moments', Elon Musk's AI startup makes hilarious graphics
item.description: Elon Musk's xAI tool Grok-2, unveiled on X, sparked controversy by allowing image creation that bypasses typical content restrictions. Available to X Premium users, it led to bizarre and provocative images of public figures circulating. Musk celebrated its uncensored nature despite past backlash from explicit AI-generated content involving celebrities, including Taylor Swift.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: King Charles III terminates security for Prince Andrew at Royal Lodge
item.description: King Charles III decided to terminate Prince Andrew's 10-man security team at Royal Lodge, hinting that Andrew may soon vacate. Andrew has lived at the 31-room Royal Lodge since 2004 and faces mounting pressure due to his ties with Jeffrey Epstein. The financial burden on the Duke is significant, with King Charles already covering private security costs.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Michelle Obama to speak at the Democratic National Convention. It was not on official agenda
item.description: Former First Lady Michelle Obama will speak at the Democratic National Convention in Chicago on Tuesday, multiple reports claimed. Michelle Obama continues to rank as one of the most popular figures but her name was missing in the official line up of the DNC. The Democratic National Convention will be livestreamed on the convention's website and social media platforms. Primetime programming will be held at the United Center, which also hosted the 1996 DNC. 50,000 total visitors are going to attend the convention.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Trump forget which state he was in? 'Is Trump OK?' Watch
item.description: Donald Trump on Saturday shouted out North Carolina from the campaign rally. But the problem was he was in Pennsylvania and his action did not go unnoticed and people thought he confused North Carolina and Pennsylvania and whether he was in sound mind and body. The Trump campaign, however, strongly defended the 'confusion' and said Trump was addressing a group of supporters from North Carolina whom he knew.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Extreme heat at Colorado airshow sickens 100, hospitalises 10
item.description: Extreme heat at the Pikes Peak Regional Airshow in Colorado Springs led to approximately 100 people needing emergency treatment, with 10 hospitalised on Saturday. Quick actions by organizers and emergency officials prevented more serious injuries. The event saw sold-out tickets, and attendees were reminded to stay hydrated amid the ongoing heat advisory issued by the National Weather Service.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Maureen Dowd gets hate for calling Biden to Kamala shift a coup
item.description: Columnist Maureen Dowd was slammed on social media for her opinion piece for NYT in which she called the Biden to Kamala Harris power shift a 'coup'. Titled "The Dems are Delighted. But a Coup is Still a Coup", Maureen wrote that as the Dems are all set for their convention in Chicago, there is a "wave of euphoria, exuberance, exultation" but everyone is made at one another.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Rep Anna Paulina Luna says 'Kamala is worst thing to happen...' amid swimsuit row
item.description: ​Florida Rep Anna Paulina Luna who has gone viral for her old swimsuit photo said Kamala Harris is the worst thing to happen to the country in a while. Appearing on the Fox News amid her controversy, Anna said she has done more as a member of the Congress than Kamala Harris.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Eating a bag of Doritos?': Elisabeth Hasselbeck gets schooled for slamming Kamala Harris
item.description: Vice president Kamala Harris said she ate a family-sized bag of nacho Doritos the night of the 2016 election. "I did not share one chip with anybody. Not even Doug. I just watched the TV with utter shock and dismay," Kamala Harris wrote in a fundraiser mail creating a fresh debate whether a world leader should binge-eat to sail through emotional crisis.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Bangladesh deposed PM Sheikh Hasina sued in 2013 'mass murder' case
Thai king endorses Paetongtarn Shinawatra as prime minister
item.description: Paetongtarn, 37, becomes Thailand's youngest prime minister just days after ally Srettha Thavisin was dismissed as premier by the Constitutional Court, a judiciary central to Thailand's two decades of intermittent political turmoil.
